title.narrative: Pilot project on improved energy provision for refugees, displaced people and host communities in selected woredas in Somali region, Ethiopia

description.narrative: ZOA and Dorcas have experience in the sector in Ethiopia, and Hivos is providing technical advice from their office in Nairobi, Kenya.This project is coordinated with the Government of Ethiopia and UNHCR. Project start is 18 June 2018, likely the project will receive an extension until 31 March 2020.This project is focusing on three aspects:1) Seeking innovation on the ground by using an enterprising approach , through community engagement.2) Building evidence for Fuel Saving Stoves (FSS) and briquette production cases and share its impact to support scaling-up.3) Building on the Comprehensive Refugee Response Framework (CRRF) and the Refugee Proclamation to identify viable business models and means for sustainable self-sufficiency within the refugee setting (in Somali region).4) Mutual learning and sharing of information with the government and other partner agencies in Ethiopia.The project is being implemented, with training of the eight participating cooperatives by the national consulting firm FER. The procurement of equipment to make fuel saving stoves and briquettes has started.We are taking into account the lessons learnt on support to energy interventions in other parts of the Ethiopia (notably Oromiya, Tigray and Gambella).We are documenting the practices of other organisations who have been aiming to provide fuel efficient options to communities in Somali Region.One of the important areas of enquiry is which biomass is most likely to be available in the different areas where we are targeting our support.An important line of investigation is which business model will work best.Attached are three pictures taken near the Melkadida refugee camp in Somali region, Ethiopia, which illustrate also the relevance of the project.
